title: Patriots vs. Falcons live updates: Can Patriots extend win streak to six games?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots aim to extend winning streak to six games against the Falcons at Gillette Stadium.
Quarterback Drake Maye faces NFL's top-ranked pass defense, which allows 149.1 passing yards per game.
Patriots' Rhamondre Stevenson out with a toe injury; game airs on CBS and 98.5 The Sports Hub.

title: 10 defendants, including a grandma, indicted in statewide sex trafficking case
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Ten defendants indicted in a Massachusetts sex trafficking case involving multiple counties, including Essex and Middlesex.
Gianni Martinez and grandmother Rosa Garcia allegedly trafficked victims and collected payments from them, according to the AG's office.
Charges include trafficking, deriving support from prostitution, and money laundering; victims' communications revealed involvement in commercial sex acts.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Miles Teller hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Miles Teller hosted 'SNL' on Nov. 2 for the second time, with Brandi Carlile as the musical guest.
Teller participated in a political cold open mock debate, playing Andrew Cuomo alongside Zohran Mamdani and Curtis Sliwa.
Brandi Carlile made her fourth 'SNL' appearance, previously performing with Elton John in the Season 50 episode.

title: Regulators are limiting a proposed Eversource rate hike in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: The Massachusetts DPU denied part of Eversource's proposed rate hike, saving customers millions in heating costs.
Eversource failed to meet 3 of 18 performance metrics including safety and emissions, affecting their rate increase request.
Gov. Maura Healey criticized the proposed hikes, calling them unaffordable, while Eversource may seek larger future increases.

title: Wayland schools investigating after Black student targeted in racist locker room incident
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Wayland High School is investigating a racist incident involving a Black student's jersey displayed on a street safety figure.
School Principal Allyson Mizoguchi and Superintendent David Fleishman condemned the act, emphasizing the need for accountability and education.
The Wayland Police Department is investigating with the Middlesex DA's Office, planning community talks and involving the Anti-Defamation League.

title: Kevin Durant, Rockets pummel exhausted Celtics to snap three-game winning streak: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Celtics' three-game winning streak ended with a 128-101 defeat by Rockets, amid grueling schedule.
Kevin Durant led the Rockets with 26 points, as the team shot 65.5% from three-point range.
Boston faced a 35-7 free-throw disparity, continuing pattern from prior game's free-throw challenges.

title: Patriots elevate veteran RB D’Ernest Johnson ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: The Patriots have elevated running back D'Ernest Johnson from the practice squad ahead of Sunday's game against the Falcons.
Johnson joins TreVeyon Henderson and Terrell Jennings in the backfield, following injuries to Rhamondre Stevenson and Antonio Gibson.
Johnson, a seven-year NFL veteran, could contribute on both offense and special teams, providing kick return experience.

title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov form a new top defensive pair for the Boston Bruins, enhancing their defensive performance.
The Bruins recorded three consecutive wins and improved defensive stats with the McAvoy-Zadorov pairing, allowing one goal in 73:24 5-on-5 ice time.
Boston's defense saw additional stability with Hampus Lindholm's return, achieving a 5-1-0 record when he plays.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed just one goal in a 2-1 win over Carolina after recent goalie rotation changes.
Joonas Korpisalo started consecutive games for the Bruins, achieving a .933 save percentage in victories over the Islanders and Sabres.
Head coach Marco Sturm cited the luxury of having two solid goaltenders for the rotation adjustments amid Boston's busy schedule.

title: 9 things to know about Red Sox’ situation entering MLB offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox enter offseason with Craig Breslow as chief baseball officer, poised to explore top free agents and trades.
Alex Bregman might opt out of his contract; Trevor Story and Lucas Giolito have options for the 2026 season.
Red Sox have $218.92 million in salaries for 2026, approaching luxury tax; could target first and second basemen upgrades.
